title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2409.1 - Duration of eligibility
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2409.1 - Duration of eligibility

State Regulations
(a) A
recipient's eligibility to receive an award made under this Subchapter shall
extend for a maximum of four regular academic years of undergraduate study, or
five regular academic years if the program of attendance is approved as such
by, or on behalf of, the corporation. (b) A student shall be eligible for a fifth
year of benefits even if the student has not yet completed four full years of
credit because of failure, reduced programs, transfer, or other reasons, so
long as the student is currently enrolled in a five-year program. However, the
student who requires more than four years to complete a program normally
completed in four years shall not be considered as enrolled in a five-year
program, except as specifically provided above. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2409.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
